Thursday, May 24, 2007























Study: Saturn's rings are dense clumps
Saturn's rings may look smooth and even when viewed through a telescope but they are in fact made up of clumps of particles and may be much denser than realized, scientists said on Tuesday.
FULL STORY




















Virgin shark birth
Female sharks can fertilize their own eggs and give birth without sperm from males, according to a new study.
FULL STORY






Remembering Wally Schirra
Former astronauts remembered colleague Walter "Wally" Schirra as a top-notch aviator, national hero and inveterate prankster.
FULL STORY






Wet past on Mars
Rover Spirit has uncovered the strongest evidence yet that Mars used to be wetter than previously thought.
FULL STORY






China's moonshot
China plans to launch a lunar orbiter in the second half of 2007.
FULL STORY
